 She was found guilty of insider trading. This cheats the "little people", like the ones she sells her overpriced products to, and the ones who shop at K-Mart (where she would never stoop to go). She did not even stand to lose much money if the stock nose-dived with her money. It would have been a drop in the bucket of her fortune. I personally could care less if it was ten dollars, it is the principle of the thing. Any one of the "regular" people would be placed on the chopping block for what she did, I guess she thinks her celebrity entitles her to cheat. So I say, Sleep well Martha, in your gorgeous 7x9 cinderblock cell, complete with stainless steel open air toilet and heavy chain link door. Those of us little people on the outside will sleep well on our non-Martha-brand sheets that we got at Wallmart or K-Mart in our own beds, where we are free to leave the house in the morning and can use the toilet in privacy. emoticon_xbye

 They should all be tried in a court of law, as Martha was. I hope they are convicted as well, and if the accusations are true, they deserve to go to jail for a long time. You will get no political favoritism from me on issues like this. If they broke the law, they deserve to pay the penalty. 
 
 The other thing I want to point out: Don't look at the 2 different cases and compare them in degree, thinking that Martha should not be punished since she only cheated a little in comparison to the Enron boys, they are 2 seperate cases. They both deserve punishment for their crimes.

 Everyone heard all about Martha when she was first named in charges, just like everyone heard all about K. Lay and Enron when the story first came to light about them. Then everything died off for a while. The reason you heard so much about Martha lately was that she was in trial, and has since been convicted. If you turn on the news today, you might hear something, but nothing near like a few weeks ago. It is the same thing with the Enron boys. Nothing is happening with their case right now, but as soon as it does, they will dominate the news just like Martha did. The media is not a bunch of right wing yes-men that are going to bow down to the Bush administration and stop doing stories about K. Lay just because of some grand republican scheme to keep things quiet. I think you have seen too many conspiracy theory documentaries on the history channel or something. If anything, the news is overwhelmingly skewed to the left, and will be more critical of the Enron boys due to their political ties to the republicans. But try to focus, we were talking about Martha.
